newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine mother clings to car to save kids.
newsitem.headline: Argentine mother clings to car to save kids.

text.p: A desperate Argentine mother whose car was being stolen with her 7-year-old son inside threw herself in front of the car, then grabbed hold of the exhaust pipe when the car ran over her, witnesses said.

They told television reporters in the city of Cordoba on Wednesday that Monica Juncos, 36, was dragged along beneath the car for nearly a block until the thief had to slow down because of a pothole. Passers-by blocked the road, forcing him to stop, pulled him out of the car and called the police.

Juncos, who was shopping with her son and 2-month-old daughter, had gone into a store with the baby when the thief struck. When she saw the car being stolen she left the baby in the shop and sprang into action.
She suffered bruises and burns from the exhaust pipe but was recovering well in a hospital. The thief was identified as a policeman suspended from duty two years ago.
